definitions.definition: a long, sturdy piece of timber or metal set upright in the ground and used to support something or as a marker.
examples: follow the blue posts until the track meets a forestry road

definitions.definition: a goalpost.
examples: Robertson, at the near post, headed wide

definitions.definition: a starting post or winning post.
examples: noun: the post

definitions.definition: an online posting.
display (a notice) in a public place.
examples: a curt notice had been posted on the door
synonyms: tack (up) "the notice posted on the wall"

definitions.definition: announce or publish (something, especially a financial result).
examples: the company posted a $460,000 loss
synonyms: publish "the group posted a net profit"

definitions.definition: (of a player or team) achieve or record (a particular score or result).
examples: Smith and Lamb posted a century partnership

definitions.definition: publish the name of (a member of the armed forces) as missing or dead.
examples: a whole troop had been posted missing

definitions.definition: put notices on or in.
examples: we have posted all the bars

definitions.definition: make (information) available on the Internet.
submit (a message, link, image, etc.) to an online location, such as a blog, social media website, or forum.
examples: the list was promptly posted all over the Internet

definitions.definition: the official service or system that delivers letters and parcels.
examples: winners will be notified by post

definitions.definition: letters and parcels delivered.
examples: she was opening her post

definitions.definition: a single collection or delivery of letters or parcels.
examples: entries must be received no later than first post on Friday, June 14th

definitions.definition: used in names of newspapers.
examples: noun: Post

definitions.definition: one of a series of couriers who carried mail on horseback between fixed stages.
a person or vehicle that carries mail.
send (a letter or parcel) via the postal system.
examples: I've just been to post a letter
synonyms: put in the mail "post the order form today"

definitions.definition: (in bookkeeping) enter (an item) in a ledger.
examples: post the transaction in the second column
synonyms: register "post the transaction in the second column"

definitions.definition: complete (a ledger) by posting transactions.
travel with relays of horses.
examples: we posted in an open carriage

definitions.definition: travel with haste; hurry.
examples: he comes posting up the street

definitions.definition: a position of paid employment; a job.
examples: he resigned from the post of foreign minister
synonyms: opening "there were seventy candidates for the post"

definitions.definition: a place where someone is on duty or where a particular activity is carried out.
examples: a worker asleep at his post

definitions.definition: a place where a soldier, guard, or police officer is stationed or that they patrol.
examples: he gave the two armed men orders not to leave their posts

definitions.definition: a force stationed at a permanent position or camp; a garrison.
a local group in an organization of military veterans.
the status or rank of full-grade captain in the Royal Navy.
examples: Captain Miller was made post in 1796

definitions.definition: send (someone) to a particular place to take up an appointment.
examples: he was posted to Washington as military attaché
synonyms: locate "armed guards were posted beside the exit"

definitions.definition: station (someone, especially a soldier, guard, or police officer) in a particular place.
examples: a guard was posted at the entrance
